bioAsHtml:
Dr. Lawrence M. Krauss is an American theoretical physicist and cosmologist. He was born in New York City and grew up in Toronto Canada. In addition to his teaching and theoretical physic research Dr. Krauss is also an author of several bestselling books. Among his best is The Physics of Star Trek and A Universe From Nothing which brings the science of existence to the forefront.

Dr. Krauss received his undergraduate degrees in mathematics and physics from Carleton University and went on to receive his Ph.D in physics from the Massachusetts Institute Technology. He spent some time as an assistant professor at Yale University and as an associate professor later on. From there he became the Ambrose Swasey Professor of Physics, professor of astronomy, and chairman of the physics department at Case Western Reserve University. Currently he is on the board and is the Foundation Professor in the School of Earth and Space Exploration and the Department of Physics in the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences.
